comments:
Not nice to face this bug as you try to start Eclipse for the first time in 
your life:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of 
boot plug-in or specify -boot.
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.searchForBoot(Main.java:424)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:237)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

If we don'g get an answer very soon, we shall just walk away - glad that we 
have not wasted more evaluation time - 16 frustrated developers.

Please provide more information.
Thanks.

Which build of Eclipse are you using?
What is the name of the directory you have Eclipse installed in?
What filesystem type are you running Eclipse from? (FAT/NTFS/Netware/etc)
What locale are you running in?
How did you start Eclipse? (just download the zip file from the web and extract 
it and double-click on the exe?)

Comments from the originator:


> Which build of Eclipse are you using? The latest stable release downloaded
twice from your Web site over the last three days.

> What is the name of the directory you have Eclipse installed in?
D:\Downloads\Java\Tools\Eclipse. Why do you need that?

> What filesystem type are you running Eclipse from? (FAT/NTFS/Netware/etc)
NTFS

> What locale are you running in?
Windows 2000. Is that the right answer?
Alternatively: Pacific Standard Time. Is that a better answer?
Or may be: My office at home? Does this work?


> How did you start Eclipse? (just download the zip file from the web and
extract
> it and double-click on the exe?)
Precisely. On regressing the VM to 1.3.1_06 I now get:


I hope the above should give a clue?

which VM are you using?
what is the locale of your machine? (for example, en_US)
*** Bug 30760 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

No more information from originator.
Closing.

traces.message: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of  boot plug-in or specify -boot.
